org.youscope.addon.microscopeaccess

Interface MicroscopeInternal


  • public interface MicroscopeInternal
    Internal interface of the microscope. Non-remote, and all functions changing the microscope state have to be provided with the access ID.
    Author:
    langmo

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addConfigurationListener(MicroscopeConfigurationListener listener)
      Adds a listener which gets informed if the configuration of the microscope changes.

      Adds a listener which gets informed when the state of the microscope changes.

      • getDeviceLoader

        DeviceLoaderInternal getDeviceLoader()
                              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns a class with which the device driver settings of the microscope can be modified.
        Returns:
        Interface to modify device driver settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If modifying device driver settings is not supported.

      • getMicroscopeConfiguration

        MicroscopeConfigurationInternal getMicroscopeConfiguration()
        Returns an interface with which general configuration settings of the microscope can be changed.
        Returns:
        General configuration settings.

      • getDevices

        DeviceInternal[] getDevices()
        Returns a list of all devices of this microscope, or an empty list if this microscope does not have any devices.
        Returns:
        List of all devices.

      • getDevices

        DeviceInternal[] getDevices(DeviceType type)
        Returns a list of all devices of the given type, or an empty list if no such device is configured.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the devices to query for.
        Returns:
        List of all devices of the given type.

      • setFocusDevice

        void setFocusDevice(java.lang.String deviceID,
                    int accessID)
             throws DeviceException,
                    MicroscopeLockedException
        Sets the default focus device.
        Parameters:
        deviceID - Name of focus device.
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        DeviceException
        MicroscopeLockedException

      • applyDeviceSetting

        void applyDeviceSetting(DeviceSetting setting,
                        int accessID)
                 throws SettingException,
                        MicroscopeLockedException,
                        MicroscopeException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the given device property to the given value. Does synchronize to the devices afterwards.
        Parameters:
        setting - Structure containing device, property and value configuration.
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        SettingException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        MicroscopeException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • applyDeviceSettings

        void applyDeviceSettings(DeviceSetting[] settings,
                         int accessID)
                  throws SettingException,
                         MicroscopeLockedException,
                         MicroscopeException,
                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the given device properties to the given values. Same as calling setDeviceSetting for every element in the array, except that the microscope is locked during the whole procedure, thus either all or none of the settings is set. Does synchronize to the devices afterwards.
        Parameters:
        settings - Array of structures containing device, property and value configurations.
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        SettingException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        MicroscopeException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • applyDeviceSettingAsync

        void applyDeviceSettingAsync(DeviceSetting setting,
                             int accessID)
                      throws SettingException,
                             MicroscopeLockedException,
                             MicroscopeException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the given device property to the given value. Does not synchronize to the devices afterwards (i.e. does not wait for the actions to be finished).
        Parameters:
        setting - Structure containing device, property and value configuration.
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        SettingException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        MicroscopeException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • applyDeviceSettingsAsync

        void applyDeviceSettingsAsync(DeviceSetting[] settings,
                              int accessID)
                       throws SettingException,
                              MicroscopeLockedException,
                              MicroscopeException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the given device properties to the given values. Same as calling setDeviceSetting for every element in the array, except that the microscope is locked during the whole procedure, thus either all or none of the settings is set. Does not synchronize to the devices afterwards (i.e. does not wait for the actions to be finished).
        Parameters:
        settings - Array of structures containing device, property and value configurations.
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        SettingException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        MicroscopeException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • lockExclusiveWrite

        void lockExclusiveWrite(int accessID)
                 throws MicroscopeLockedException
        Locks the microscope for a longer time (e.g. for the duration of a measurement), such that only the locker may acquire the write lock to the microscope. However, read locks may be acquired, as long as the thread is not actually acquiring the write-lock... Must be surrounded by a try-finally block with unlockExclusiveWrite in the finally statement.
        Parameters:
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeLockedException - Thrown if microscope is already locked for a longer time by somebody else.

      • unlockExclusiveWrite

        void unlockExclusiveWrite(int accessID)
                   throws MicroscopeLockedException
        Unlocks the previously acquired lock.
        Parameters:
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID or not locked at all, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeLockedException - Thrown if this microscope object is not the owner of the exclusive write lock.

      • initializeMicroscope

        void initializeMicroscope(int accessID)
                   throws MicroscopeException,
                          MicroscopeLockedException,
                          java.lang.InterruptedException
        Initializes the microscope.
        Parameters:
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • uninitializeMicroscope

        void uninitializeMicroscope(int accessID)
                     throws MicroscopeException,
                            MicroscopeLockedException,
                            java.lang.InterruptedException
        Uninitializes the microscope. All loaded devices are unload.
        Parameters:
        accessID - The access ID of the current microscope object. If the microscope is locked with a different accessID, a MicroscopeLockedException is thrown.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • emergencyStop

        void emergencyStop()
        Stops the XY stage of the microscope and prevents ASAP any other thread to obtain access to the microscope.

      • resetEmergencyStop

        void resetEmergencyStop()
        Resets the emergency-stop state, such that microscope can be accessed again.

      • isEmergencyStopped

        boolean isEmergencyStopped()
        Returns true if microscope is currently in the emergency-stop state.
        Returns:
        TRUE if emergency-stopped.

        Removes a previously added listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener.
